alert.note: Alert for Cimarron (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 8:37PM CDT until August 18 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Cimarron River at Kenton 2NE affecting Cimarron County. For the Cimarron River...including Kenton 2NE, Forgan 8N...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Cimarron River at Kenton 2NE. * WHEN...From this evening to early Thursday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 5.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.0 feet tomorrow morning. - Action stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 400 AM CDT.
